name: Physician Formal Report - Implant Infection
description: Formal clinical report from physician about implant-associated infection requiring removal.

headers.subject: Adverse Event Report - Spinal Fusion System Infection - Patient ID 78234

raw_input.body:
To Whom It May Concern,

I am writing to report a serious adverse event involving your SpineFix Posterior Fusion System.

Patient Information:
- Age: 56 years
- Sex: Male
- Procedure Date: January 15, 2024
- Device: SpineFix Posterior Fusion System, Model SF-400
- Lot Number: SF2023-L892

Clinical Summary:
Patient underwent L4-L5 posterior spinal fusion on January 15, 2024. On February 28, 2024, patient presented with increasing lower back pain, fever (101.2°F), and elevated inflammatory markers (CRP 85 mg/L, ESR 72 mm/hr). CT imaging revealed fluid collection adjacent to hardware with possible abscess formation.

Cultures obtained via CT-guided aspiration grew Staphylococcus aureus (MSSA). Despite IV antibiotic therapy (cefazolin), infection failed to resolve. Patient underwent surgical debridement and hardware removal on March 4, 2024.

Device Disposition:
Removed hardware has been retained and is available for manufacturer evaluation if requested.

Please contact me if you require additional clinical information.

Sincerely,
Dr. Sarah Chen, MD, FACS
Department of Orthopedic Surgery
University Hospital Medical Center
Phone: (555) 234-5678

event_info.event_description: Patient developed infection at spinal fusion site 6 weeks post-surgery. CT imaging revealed fluid collection with possible abscess. Cultures grew Staphylococcus aureus. IV antibiotics failed to resolve infection. Patient required surgical debridement and hardware removal.
event_info.patient_outcome: Surgical debridement and hardware removal required
event_info.device_outcome: Hardware removed and retained for evaluation
